name: TheAtlantic
text: In the run-up to the November 3 election, we’re publishing a series in which the journalist @ejeancarroll interviews women who, like her, have accused Donald Trump of sexual harassment or assault. Today, Jessica Leeds’s story: https://t.co/ellLg4UWvH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It's like he's got four extra hands. He's grabbing my breasts. He's trying to kiss me. I'm trying to get his hands off me … it's when he starts putting his hand up my skirt that I get a jolt of strength and manage to wiggle out of the seat.” https://t.co/ellLg4UWvH

name: TheAtlantic
text: This spring laid bare America’s faults. In the October issue of our magazine, we look at where the country can go from here. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/hIBgr4BTaU

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When the mood goblins come to call and I have to fight them, I find comfort in knowing that I’m not faced with forever—that I can take eternity one hour at a time," @tcheneyauthor writes: https://t.co/LDeIIgsOj8

name: TheAtlantic
text: Latinos' political potential is being squandered by the major parties, @realcpaz reports. https://t.co/TgzZ3WsZEk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos of the Week: Chief Mouser, Drone Star, Ice Swimmer - 35 images from the past seven days, including a Colorado snowstorm, donkey therapy, roller skating in New York, and much more. https://t.co/aExIxbflXf https://t.co/AEuCFoh4TT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @sarahzhang: What happens if your sperm donor lied? 

https://t.co/ZxESaQDFy6

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PaulBisceglio: "The scene seemed to revert to a neutral gray, as if the smartphones that captured the pictures were engaged in a conspiracy to silence this latest cataclysm. 

The reality is both less and more unnerving."

https://t.co/l8M9d9aoex by @ibogost

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: In the run-up to the November 3 election, we’re publishing a series in which the journalist @ejeancarroll interviews women who, like her, have accused Donald Trump of sexual harassment or assault. Today, Jessica Leeds’s story. https://t.co/f4ltn0HJl0

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: “... decisions so ordinarily meaningless that it’s simultaneously easy to see either the supernatural guiding hand of a higher power or the sheer banality of chance” https://t.co/ULCXihaO4g

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @arthurbrooks: The current period of transition in my life reminds me of fishing in the ocean. The best time to catch fish is during a quickly changing tide. Practically the only mistake you can make is not to have your line in the water. My latest @TheAtlantic https://t.co/poEFhV5nSA

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: "More than 25,000 Latinos have already died. More than 3 million are unemployed...

But as campaigning for the general election ramps up, another casualty of the virus’s relentless attack is becoming clear: The pandemic may stunt Latino political power."

https://t.co/AiPbXnL8Ei

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @ibogost: I wrote about those orange wildfire skies turned grey in pictures. Cameras aren't mirrors that capture the world; they are machines that make images out of it. https://t.co/MocVXbow7y

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: “Instead of hearing a motivating message to encourage them to vote, many Latinos aren’t hearing anything at all.” Essential reading this morning, from ⁦@realcpaz⁩:  https://t.co/q8AWwJaAOv

name: TheAtlantic
text: The orange wildfire skies confused smartphone cameras. @ibogost explains why: https://t.co/nc03ibJjV1

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: “The question is who gets to claim America, and what does it mean to be a full citizen of this country. That, ultimately, is what is on the line.” Read @realcpaz on Latino voters and the stakes of the 2020 election.
https://t.co/uOjagvzN5t

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "How did Jessica know? Because Jessica is an old bat. Old bats are the best. I am an old bat myself. We old bats don’t kid ourselves." https://t.co/y1FK5khsPA

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @rachgutman: "The 9/11 attacks unfolded, from start to finish, over just 102 minutes ... The government never had a chance to muster a response. During the pandemic... each new death is the consequence of a botched response, a government that didn’t care enough." https://t.co/Pr27ratexx

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: Cameras "aren’t windows on the world, but simply machines that turn views of that world into images." @ibogost pulled this off like no one else could. (And special thanks to @robinsloan for the photo assist.)  https://t.co/OcCq90nOkM

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: I get to hear what @sarahzhang is thinking about all the time; reading this is a very good way for everyone else to get a taste https://t.co/3R5DwL6ZGq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: “I know that if the story gets any attention, the first thing Trump will say is that I’m not pretty enough,” Jessica says. “I know instinctively that’s what he’s going to say.” https://t.co/KbFcNw4GSP

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PaulBisceglio: Sperm-donor banks are "promising young men in college towns—maybe down on their luck, in need of money—an easy and anonymous way to make serious money."

https://t.co/pb7W0t910r by @sarahzhang

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: Nearly half of Latinos polled know of a family member or friend who is sick with the coronavirus: https://t.co/QIP3OLJ1dw via @realcpaz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"The president’s criticism of military contractors is belied by his commitment to fattening their pockets," writes @AdamSerwer:
https://t.co/kP47uCndV5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Elementary school science teacher Gary Koppelman thinks children are born with the traits of a good scientist. He built a lab with nearly 80 species of animals and more than 125 species of plants to let those instincts thrive, @kristinarizga reports: https://t.co/5Ftb84woea

name: TheAtlantic
text: New reports warn that Russian hackers are attempting to interfere with the 2020 election. In June, @FranklinFoer examined why Russia’s goal was never to elect Donald Trump, but to dismantle American democracy: https://t.co/c5DXDYliQh

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Festival, taking place virtually September 21-24, announces new interviews: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, Bill Gates, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, and Maryland Governor Larry Hogan. https://t.co/DTRgPFIdlj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AnnieLowrey: No, refusing a plastic straw isn't going to save the planet. But that doesn't mean personal efforts to go green are futile. I went long on how and why consumer choices matter when it comes to our climate nightmare: https://t.co/346Nvq5sV6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books by Malcolm X, Austin Reed, Susan Burton, and others writing from prison raise vital questions about how we can build a more just society, in this week’s #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @krisguillaume: https://t.co/32OkVfEIk2

name: TheAtlantic
text: “As COVID-19 has transformed the way that Americans live, and threatens to claim exponentially more lives than any terrorist has, it is time to finally end the chapter of our history that began on September 11, 2001,” @brhodes argues: https://t.co/7LvRkloZMT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If not for the attacks, his body might have had the strength to fight off the coronavirus." @IsaacDovere reports on a day of campaigning—as the coronavirus comes for 9/11 survivors: https://t.co/aEVsInZfM3

name: TheAtlantic
text: After my husband was killed on 9/11, I lived for our daughters, @esbakalian wrote in 2019: “The terrorists took my husband from me; there was no way I was going to let them ruin my daughters’ precious psyches too.” https://t.co/oRIRjh3fSz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Jessica Leeds alleges that President Donald Trump sexually assaulted her on an airplane four decades ago. She was one of the first women to publicly accuse Trump of assault in 2016. Read the latest installment from our series, by @ejeancarroll: https://t.co/k7THnQnbKh

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: This @IsaacDovere piece on the intersection of the pandemic, 9/11, and the presidential campaign is worth your time: https://t.co/URwNWv16NC
